text: English pronunciation lesson 11 topic
can and can't part 2 can now let's talk
about can there are two ways we can say
this word stressed or unstressed let's
first look at the pronunciation when can
is stressed the phonetic transcription
looks like this
as a stressed word the vowel sound is
going to be long and strong will stress
can when it's in a final position or
when it's before a pause for example if
you can call me here can is stressed
because it's before a pause there's a
comma so we pause if you can call me I
think I can again can is stressed
because it's in the final position
there's nothing following it there's a
long pause a period now let's look at
this sentence
it's rather a statement I can come who
said I can't we're going to stress can
here for emphasis
so if you're emphasizing can the
affirmative you also stress it make the
vowel sound long and strong so in all
three examples we have a stressed can if
you can call me I think I can I can come
who said I can't
now let's talk about the unstressed
pronunciation of can it's a shorter
pronunciation and we use it when can is
followed by other words like in a
question can you come or when can is not
a main verb
she can see well so in this sentence can
is not stressed si is the main verb and
that receives the stress and in that
first question again the main verb is
come so calm receives the main stress
these verbs then are shorter because
they're unstressed what's the phonetic
transcription of this shorter unstressed
pronunciation well there are actually
two possibilities let me show you
the first one is Kim the second one is
Kim remember when we said this verb
stressed the phonetic transcription
looked like this and I said that the
vowel sound was long and strong now we
need a vowel sound that is shorter and
weaker what also may help is to
understand how do you move your lips how
do you move your tongue the stressed can
makes you pull your lips out and your
tongue is rather flat and pushed forward
can when it's unstressed using this
first pronunciation your lips are
slightly more relaxed but your tongue is
still flat and pushed forward can again
in the second alternative pronunciation
your lips are completely relaxed and
your tongue is no longer flat and pushed
forward the middle part is actually
pushed up a bit Kin Kin Kin let's try
saying all three pronunciations first
I'll say one and then you repeat after
me the first one is stressed can-can now
let's try the unstressed pronunciation
can again and the alternative unstressed
pronunciation again again let's go back
to our two models statements first I'll
say it this way can again can you come
can you come
she can see well she can see well now
try it with the alternative
pronunciation and stressed can you come
can you come she can see well she can
see well exercise 1 listen and repeat
question who will tell me about Superman

i said i can i can i can't see was

can they can they can they I said can

help

was different five now this one will be

statements will be negative what you
need to listen for is whether I say a

are you ready he can't he can't he can't

listening task watch and listen again
- Jennifer speak about her vision how
well do you understand the difference
between can and can't and spoken English
hopefully this task will be easier the
second time I'll bet you didn't know
that I can't see very well without
contacts or glasses it's true I have
very poor vision on what they call
nearsighted that means I can see clearly
when things are very close but I can't
see things at a distance other people
are farsighted they can see at a
distance but they can't see clearly when
objects are close for example they can't
read without glasses in my case
hopefully everything will change in two
days because I'm going to have ice
surgery the technology these days is
pretty good because they can correct my
vision in about 15 minutes with the
laser I'm a little nervous but I can
hardly wait for the results so wish me
luck let's do a review we looked at
different pronunciations of camp the
negative and can the affirmative can't
can have two different pronunciations
try to hear the difference can't can't
can can be stressed or unstressed when
we stress this verb we say can
unstressed that valsa becomes shorter
